Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Good Area”
Reviews.Author: SuzQTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent two nights at the Market Hotel in Barcelona. We found the hotel to be nice and we enjoyed our stay. The decor of the hotel is "funky" but I really liked it (even the Chairman Mao posters); the rooms are nice; and the shower was incredible. The location worked for us as we were in walking distance of some good restaurants and within a 15-minute walk of the Ramblas. The only drawback for us was our room was somewhat noisy - maybe an inner room would be better and not as noisy. The women at reception were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “overall a good experience, but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: Emily D
Reviews.Content: good: location, restaurant, rainfall shower w/ cool black tiling needs improvement: tacky wall decor (which was surprising considering how elegantly decorated the restaurant is), terrible scratchy bedding, paper thin walls (they even said they put me in a "quiet" room, but you can hear doors slam whenever anyone returns or leaves) all in all this was a good hotel, and not a bad price for what it is, but there are definitely some things that need improved. i would call this a "budget design hotel" that could work it's way up to a more luxurious category if they just tried a little harder. service was typical of europe- not super friendly but got the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwall722
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice while traveling through Barcelona. I liked the modern furnishings in the room, very nice bathrooms, and overall feel of the hotel. The shower was probably the best part of the whole experience! The staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a little expensive but had a good selection (don't get there too late though!) Overall a nice hotel and good value, would stay there again. It's also easy to get to from the Airport using the Aerobus and walking from the Urgell stop, about a 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting,hotel, good value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Louandskip
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, the hotel has many things going for it. The location is pretty good, the lobby is beautiful. The Young girl at the check in counter was wonderful. She spoke English and gave us maps of the city and explained how to get places. There is a nice bar with an outside area to sit with cushions and blankets. The only down sides for us: the bed was too firm for me and the Internet did not work in the room. The hotel is also hard to find. But for the price, we paid 89 euros I thought it was a good value. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great restaurant and cocktail bar!”
Reviews.Author: basilfawlty007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2011 and had a great time. Complimentary water and apples were funny yet useful. Have already made plans to stay again in August 2012. Cant wait, their mojitos in the cocktail bar are tremendous. Rooms nice and clean and fresh towels everyday. I'd recomend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Friendly AND Affordable”
Reviews.Author: 19Beverley
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Market Hotel in mid 2011with my daughter, her friend and partners. Great area to stay, easy transport links to airport and an easy walk to Las Ramblas. The staff were very friendly and the accommodation more than adequate for the price compared with other hotels in Barcelona. I would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: emily t
Reviews.Content: In my opinion you get more than you pay for- helpful concierge, cool bar and restaurant downstairs, clean chic rooms, lots of hot water, and free apples! We were able to leave our bags at the hotel while we left town for a few days. It's also easy to get to from the airport via the Aerobus. We went with our young son, but this hotel would be good for couples, too. It's a 10 minute walk to lots of shopping but in a quiet neighborhood. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Matt W
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip through Spain and Portugal, we stumbled on this amazing boutique hotel just by chance when reading a NYT article on barcelona the week before. We couldnt be happier. Everything from the staff to the food to the rooms was idyllic. We loved it so much, and the staff was so accommodating that when our flight home from London was canceled and we had to come back, we stayed here again. Fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: expat25
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to stay in Barcelona for those few days stop over, you need look no further than the Market Hotel. This small hotel located near La Rambler is clean, tidy, quiet and offers a reasonable breakfast, at reasonable rates. Close to the markets with many tapas bars and bakeries close by for that quick coffee and pastry. We found the staff helpful and multi-lingual, wi-fi, and a great restaurant and tapas bar on site if you want to stay put, the restaurant a little pricey but quality good. The black tiles in drenching shower and stand up stone basin show a bit of water stain through use, and there is little storage for clothing, if you want to stay for a prolonged period. Depending on traffic about 30 minutes by taxi from airport.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: k2com
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Market Hotel in Barcelona for three nights and found it comfortable and a great value. It was conveniently located, we could walk or subway to all the important sights. Our room was large amnd comfortable with a very well appointed bathroom, though there was no view. The restaurant was quite good, and filled with locals. The bar was great as was the bartender...he gave us lots of great advice about where to go, when to go and what to eat. All in all, I would certainly go back when I visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great All Around Value”
Reviews.Author: joemooch
Reviews.Content: Easy walk from the 2nd stop off the Aerobus. Farther than I'd like from the Metro (Poble Sec) that goes direct to where we wanted. Friendly and informed guest relations. Easy walk to Ramblas and Olympic Park. Nice little restaurant across the street for quick breakfast. Hotel Tapas Dinner in Bar and Breakfast promo was perfect for our needs. Restaurant was very busy. Standard room was very well priced. Bath sheets with heated towel rack and great shower. Comfortable beds, secure entry, elevator, lousy TV(so what), Internet much better in bar. Never concerned about location. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tofuandpesto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an unexpected find and we were pleasantly surprised considering the price we paid. Overall the hotel is in a relatively convenient location a few stops on the metro near the main center and also close to the airport bus station. The hotel rooms are located in a building that is mixed with local residents (with sections partitioned) so you feel like you're living like a local. The nice parts: The room contains the basic amenities and the hotel also gives complementary bottles of water and apples to guests at the front desk. The rooms are bigger than expected and there's plenty of space to leave luggage open. Pretty clean too. The staff was friendly and offers good suggestions for dinner / lunch / snack options. The hotel bar is nice. The ok parts: Shower has no shower curtain or piece of glass so I ended flooding the floor each time and there's also no air vent in the bathroom and this can get quite hot. The air conditioning also magically turns on/off in the middle of the night every night. The strange part On 2 of the evenings, our neighbour kept slamming the door at 4am and calling "luca" for about 15min. It felt like he was standing at the foot of our bed and yelling at us. Sound proofing could be better but then again this might be our neighbour more than anything

Reviews.Title: “very good velue for mony”
Reviews.Author: moreti44
Reviews.Content: very good velue for mony cooparative and kind stuff nice and good hotel very good restaurant good location

Reviews.Title: “Value 4 Money @ Funky Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rik_van_Tol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in Barcelona and at walking distance from many great neighborhoods. Ask for one of the rooms with a balcony, room 701 has an almost 180 degree view of the city, and the tetras is the same size as the room. Do not expect a five star experience, but it's a great spot for a romantic weekend or a trip with friends or family. Sometimes there is a bit of a wait at reception (mostly in the mornings with check in and check out), but hee this is Spain so tranquil! The hotel has a very nice restaurant and the quality of the food was a pleasant surprise @ super sharp rates. I highly recommended this property if you want a authentic experience. Staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a big city”
Reviews.Author: ERP444
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights. The rooms are interesting, comfortable and adequate, though not large at the lowest tier of rates...might want to consider paying a bit more for a slightly larger room here. It is an easy walk from this hotel to Las Ramblas and to the funicular to Montjuic. Since the hotel is only two blocks from a station for Barcelona's excellent subway system, the entire city is very accessible. A truly outstanding feature of this hotel is its restaurant...a first class operation by any standard, yet at quite affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on a good spot”
Reviews.Author: Mastapieces
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Market Hotel Barcelona for two nights with my girlfriend. We enjoyed our stay there. Both the hotel and the location are a good choice. Its not too close to the Ramblas and the tourist things which means that its not noisy at all and hence great! Nevertheless everything can be reached within minutes, in particular if you rent a bike. The hotel rooms are nice, ask for one with a terrace in the back (I think its the rooms around 107 or so). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Prices are around 140 Euros which is a bit expensive. However given the hotels I stayed at previously in Barcelona it was well worth it to spend this amount of money. The hotel has a nice bar which is great for a drink. The food wasn't particularly amazing, rather average. Conclusion: Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A modern funky hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rphawn
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Hotel Market in Barcelona and have not one complaint. The front desk was accommodating when we arrived early and kept our bags until check-in, as well giving us a quick orientation as to where we were in relation to the city. Just outside of the old city, it is within walking distance of most everything: La Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, Metro stops, Port Olympic, restaurants galore etc. Crisp sheets and towels, working a/c, good sized shower and tub, king sized bed, quiet neighborhood, free wi-fi all made for a great experience. As a side note, we did not eat there but the restaurant and patio were full every night when we returned late from our days' activities. (It seems the Spanish don't go out to eat until 9:00 at the earliest.)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: zeffro
Reviews.Content: Hotel's in a very good location. The entrance is from the alley, which might be a little off-putting for some people. The reception staff was very welcoming and were most eager to get us accommodated even though we should up 3 hours before check-in time! The availability of apples and bottles of water for guests was a nice welcome! :) The room was much better than we had expected. Really fancy for a budget hotel. Seemed like a professional designer had some input in the interior decoration. The bathroom was huge and spacious. Rain shower was an added touch. We even had a balcony overlooking the road, which we never ended up using! The location was really good. Less than 2 minutes walk to the Metro. A slightly long walk to La Rambla. Since La Rambla itself is all about walking, it's better to take the Metro to save your energy. Make sure you have either a GPS on your phone or a street-view map on-hand when reaching the hotel for the first time. Their instructions of taking a certain bus, is not enough. You need to know how to reach the hotel from the bus stop too. As our bus stop was a block away, we used the GPS on my phone to locate the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SImple, straightforward, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rileymax56
Reviews.Content: The Market Hotel (and restaurant) were recommended to me by a colleague who lives in Barcelona. I booked in for 8 nights, and found the accommodation very nice. I got a double room on the street side with a small balcony, and loved that. Double-glazed windows kept most all of the exterior noise from the street out. I read others' reviews in which it was noted the rooms were not insulated well one from another, but I did not experience that. The Zen-like atmosphere of the accommodation was lovely and conducive to relaxing. The large rain shower in the en suite bath was a nice touch. Front desk assistance was excellent; all personnel were gracious and forthcoming with directions, restaurant recommendations, and the like. There were only two drawbacks. There are no refrigerators in the rooms. When one prefers to eat at least one meal a day in, it makes it for a bit of a challenge, as there's no place for perishables. (On the other hand, several bakeries, butchers, and grocery stores are nearby, so fresh food is readily available.) Second, the room was maintained/cleaned only very late some days (as late as 5PM). As an early riser who prefers getting out and about by 8AM, then coming back to take a mid-day nap, this was a little off-putting, as I was interrupted twice mid-day for room cleaning. Sadly, a request for AM room service did not yield results. Still, I would recommend this 3-star hotel as a reasonable, well-located, and comfortable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: avideno
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a while back, but I didn't have a chance to review the hotel at the time. This is a charming hotel with a pleasant staff, very cute rooms and a very decent restaurant. It is also convenient to a lot of fun/cool restaurants in El Ravel. It is also close enough (but not too close!) to La Rambla. Our favorite part about the hotel was coming back late one night and chatting with one of the guys who worked at the hotel. He was fun and friendly and shared a lot of information about Barcelona from a local's perspective. We really loved that and ended up utilizing a lot of his great advice. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to people who love boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very stylish hotel, great junior suites”
Reviews.Author: caznewland
Reviews.Content: The welcome was a bit lacking but overall the place made up for it. Very good value and lovely space. the restaurant food was OK, the room we had initially had lousy A/C. They moved us in the end to a very nice room. The location is much more local and less touristy which suited us, some may want to be in the thick of the attractions. We cycled using their bikes and that was very successful. Breakfast is expensive so we walked out and across the road to a local patisserie which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the building, loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: chrouNicosia_Cyprus
Reviews.Content: The rooms have been renovated beautifully and the whole building has something really special about it! The hotel restaurant is a must, but prebook because its full most of the nights. Excellent location, close to the centre but quiet surroundings. Ideal for couples, very romantic! Very helpful staff! Breakfast is not included so watch out for the extra charge!

Reviews.Title: “would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: dst123
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed here for 3 nights while we celebrated her 30th in Barcelona and we loved this hotel. We were thrilled with the price and the room was great in decor and size. The staff on the front desk were lovely and very helpful. Although we did not spend a lot of our time in the hotel it was a great place to crash, and although some may think it was noisy I think you would struggle to find a quiet hotel in Barcelona or any major city for that matter!!!! I would definately recommend this hotel to friends as it is close to the metro and within walking distance of La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and kinda random.”
Reviews.Author: mizmissfun
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights. Off rambla and in a more residential, locals only area. Quick walk to hustle and bustle. Locals only cafes and restaurants. This hotel is a bit of an adventure, two lifts to access the rooms that are situated next to residence apartments. Good crash pad if you are on a budget but can't stomach a Hostal.

Reviews.Title: “A total gem”
Reviews.Author: JABB_JFB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here upon the reccomendation of some friends and it was perfect! Good clean rooms, efficient staff, quite a funky little place and great location. Perfect for a long weekend. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel with character.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Barcelona and our stay in Market Hotel My girlfriend & I arrived into Barcelona Sants train station and found our way to Market Hotel via the Metro system. We took advantage of the 10 trip card that can be used by more than one person, it was a bargain at 7.45€ as we used the metro a lot! I would recommend travelling to Paralel via Line 3 (Green) and changing to Line 2 (Purple) and getting off at Sant Antoni. The hotel is a block down from there.  Upon our arrival we were greeted warmly by the reception staff who showed us to our room and told us about their complimentary offers on many tourist attractions and also the free water & apples! The room was lovely, we stayed in 903 which is a junior suite. It had a two-person bath, balcony, queen-sized bed and a fridge. We were both impressed by the quality and size of our room!  We read reviews on here about this hotel so took earplugs in anticipation of being in for a noisy sleep but we never needed to open the box! The only noise we heard was in our bathroom when we happened to be using it at the same time as our neighbours who appeared to enjoy speaking rather loud. The location was great for us as El Ravel is home to some splendid attractions, and we were about a 15 minute stroll from La Rambla.  Our stay in Barcelona would not have been as enjoyable if it hadn't been for this lovely, boutique hotel. If we decide to visit Barcelona again we will definitely consider this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, wish that the restaurant was as good”
Reviews.Author: Onereallyniceguy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel tucked away (and not easy to locate) but Sant Antoni Market (and metro stop). Rooms are great, hotel is well located and the staff is without equal. The restaurant, however, is hit or miss. When it's good, it's very very good. When it's bad . . .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Sailingmaniac
Reviews.Content: We were a family of three so we booked two adjoining rooms which came with a 'sitting room'. This was great for us although not the cheapest way to stay there. It was fun and definitely not your boring international hotel. We loved the free water! The reception desk helped us to rent a car from the hotel but were not always sure about other transport information. Although not totally central it was within walking distance of lots of great destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for.”
Reviews.Author: PierreVn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for two nights with my "partner in crime", hoping to find a clean, not too expensive yet stylish hotel. And that's what we found. The staff was polite and kind, no more, no less. You can get free water and apples at the reception, for me it makes up for the lack of a minibar. The hotel is not really central but I think it was for the best. The neighborhood is safe, but not very exciting. You can access the city center very easily, by foot or by (efficient) public transportation. Other reviewers said the hotel can be very noisy, and they are perfectly right. I'm a light sleeper, so I brought earplugs, and had no trouble sleeping. Still, you can hear pretty much everything that is happening in the adjacent rooms. Like others said before, the TV is small. Come on, you are in Barcelona, who cares ? But seriously, for that price, I would definitely stay there again. The interior is beautiful, especially the restaurant room. The rooms are clean and nicely decorated, it doesn't feel like you are in a hotel - I mean it in a positive way. You get somewhat the impression that you have a friend with good taste and a guest room. The bathroom was also very cool. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant once, it was good and inexpensive. Breakfast was nice too. Definitely a good pick for a cool weekend in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: iAussie
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for a week, we booked the standard double as the superior double was booked out. Check is a little tricky as the reception is off the side alley & is also an entry for the Market Restaurant down stairs, reception staff on check in were great. Really helpful and accommodated for my lack of Spanish even tho my partner is fluent. We had a room on the first floor, unfortunately the only natural light the room got was from a window facing a narrow well between the building next door. So the room was dark and got no fresh air, one of the street facing rooms would have been great. The decor is a mixture of shabby chic come modern Japanese, the double bed was actually 2 singles pushed together but still comfy so long as you're not in the middle of the 2. The bathroom was a little grubby & again dark, more so as it is all black tile & stone. Location of the Hotel was great for us, away from all the crowds & noise but still close enough to walk down to the Ramble (10-15 mins) & some great restaurant & bars. The other advantage of the location for us was parking, the hotel has discounted parking across the road for 20€ a day. This is a decent hotel for the money, we'd stay again if we could get a superior room facing the street. If not then we'd try somewhere else. We should also give a shout out to housekeeping, they were fantastic! We are not early rises, sometimes not leaving the room till after lunch. Still every day we got back to the hotel they had made up the room :)

Reviews.Title: “Very cool urban hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonathoneskel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a funky, cool place with modern fixtures in a urban setting. It was kinda hard to find at first cause its entrance is tucked around the corner in an alley. The front desk workers spoke english well enough to help us and give some directions. To get to your room is kinda weird at first cause the hotel is intertwined with an apartment so you have to take two elevators to get to your floor. You get the hang of it after the first time or two. For the people who are reviewing about complaining about noise and being safe. We arrived and night, went out at night-no issues at all about safety. Noise-Its in the middle of the city, I don't know what people are expecting when they say the hotel was too noisy. The room was modern and felt upscale. Totally recommend and relatively close to Las Ramblas if you're wanting to be near that.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not more”
Reviews.Author: Anna-KarinG
Reviews.Content: It´s the small things that makes the difference. The room (junior suite 701) was very nice and had a beautiful southfacing terrace. But we missed a good place to place our clothes, 3 hangers are not enogh for 2 persons. No hanger for outdoor clothes. We also missed a table in front of the sofa, to put a glas on or so. Maybe it´s too much to ask for a minibar or fridge of a 3-star hotel but taht would have been good. We ate at the hotel´s restaurant one evening; my husband´s food (duck) was very good but mine (veal fileet) was cold. When I told the waitress that, she came back with a steaming hot plate with meat that was so dry and hard (but hot!) that it was uneatable. I have a strange feeling of liking the hotel, it´s absolutely OK!, but I will chose another one next time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's noisy. But also comfortable, stylish and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dyfrigj
Reviews.Content: There's no avoiding the fact that this is a noisy hotel. Regardless of where you are in the building, you will hear life going on around you. Some of the noise comes from the flats which are part of same building, other noise from the street outside. But this is a hotel in the center of Barcelona. Not somewhere to go if you want peace and quiet. I loved the fact that this was cheap and central, yet felt luxurious. The hotel itself is beautifully styled, and the rooms are comfortable and spacious. No, there isn't a tea and coffee maker, but that's because this place isn't a corporate hotel. Don't come here if you judge hotels on the quality of the trouser press. Do come if you want to stay in a hotel with character and style, which will make you feel at home (but bring earplugs).

Reviews.Title: “That price is per ROOM, not per person?”
Reviews.Author: brezza
Reviews.Content: That was my comment when I saw my lovely room. Maybe the 69 euro price was per person! But, no, that's the price for two per night. I'm used to staying in 4/ 5 star hotels so I like a nice level of comfort . Market is not a 5 star yet it did NOT disappoint! Cool and stylish, just 2 min walk from the Eurobus stop and 15 min walk to the main part of town. This is in a real Barcelona neighorhood, with trees and shops, I felt very safe, with no masses of tourists. I loved the touches like wood floors, amazing waterfall shower, my room had a super wide tub, too. The bed was super comfy, I slept like a baby. Fantastic staff-- all of them . I stayed 4 nights and loved the vibe of the restaurant and bar. By the way the restaurant has GREAT prices just like the hotel - All in all, a super experience that I will tell all my friends about!

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: MROY_18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Market Hotel for about 3 nights and I must say: in a city of excellent hotels, Market was quite a find. Its located in an old building (including quaint old elevator) but the rooms are modern and well designed. Wrought iron bedstead. Tiny balcony. Loved the black tiled bathrooms. They add little touches like the free water and stuff and staff are nice too. Its an excellent choice for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy & awfull toilett smell”
Reviews.Author: El_Commandante_2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears very nice at the first glance (quite stylish), reception people are also very friendly. But nevertheless, I had two awfull nights... First and worst: It´s very noisy, I had the feeling that the busses, cars, motorcycles from the busy street nearby are just driving through my room, ear sticks did not help... Second, the ventilation in the toilett without window did not work, the awfull cloac / toilett smell spread out in the whole(small) room. At the end I left the hotel after two days and moved to another one, to get some sleep again...

Reviews.Title: “Best mid-range place in terms of location and price”
Reviews.Author: 00_ArtySmarty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my spouse for a week before traveling to France for business. We initially read about it in NYT and it lived up to the review. Market Hotel is an excellent example of a moderately priced, yet fashionable, hotel in Barcelona (a RARITY). The rooms were stylishly furnished and clean, the marble bathroom was truly wonderful. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant but we did eat/drink at the bar several times late-night and it was affordable and good-quality food. The only problems we had were that international calls could not be made on hotel phones and this was a problem as our credit card got locked due to our purchases overseas (we didn't call beforehand). The hotel is near bus routes and subway routes but you should be prepared to walk or pay for a taxi to get to the touristy parts of Barcelona. We felt very safe at night and had no trouble with pickpockets or sex workers. We specifically requested a "quiet room" on our reservation form and we slept wonderfully. It is worth noting that the early AM market that usually sets up nearby was closed for renovation, so this may have contributed to the quietness. There are some restaurants/bars within a 10 minute walk, including a fantastic tapas place called Inopia--get there early. We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great mid-priced option in Barca, slightly off the main drag.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Artemis78
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon, and it exceeded our expectations. It was quiet, modern and chic. Our room was spacious with a private terrace. The design and decor of the hotel, restaurant and bar were magazine-worthy. The people were very friendly, and it was just a quick ride into the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Nick942
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly. Rooms were clean. The restaurant was a great mix of tourists and locals and the dinner was superb. The location was equidistant from the gay bars and the beach and right by the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as it seems”
Reviews.Author: Shari T
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel about 5 months prior to staying there and got a fantastic deal on the room for 5 nights. then the bad reviews started coming in and i lost count of the numerous times i went to cancel here and book somewhere else, but with the rates i received and the proximity to public transport the hotel kept winning out (that and i found that all hotels in this area seem to have the same complaints). When we arrived we were greeted by staff who spoke fantastic English. She ended up going above and beyond her job in helping me find a restaurant that served a particular dish. Fantastic service!!! It is right near the San antoni markets which is a great place to grab breakfast if you dont wish to get it in the hotel. We actually never got around to eating at the hotel and i see it gets great reviews on here. (We thought it would be super expensive but its actually really well priced!!) I can understand that the rooms with a balcony may get a little noisy since they face the street so ask for a quiet room out the back and you will sleep pretty well. Though you do hear people closing the doors of neighboring rooms or if someone walks in high heels across the wooden floor it is quite loud but we managed to sleep through most of it. And never found it too difficult to fall back asleep. We felt the bed was very comfortable the air con was great and shower was massive and piping hot! Free wifi was GREAT too!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Cheap, and expect just that”
Reviews.Author: liipstiick
Reviews.Content: A nice and hip place to stay, but don't expect the frills. The staff are nice, but aren't about to break their backs to help. The restaurant downstairs is really beautiful and the food is great. The rooms are a bit small, but nicely designed. Ideal if you're young and want to stay somewhere hip but don't want to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you have realistic expectations.”
Reviews.Author: hcajones
Reviews.Content: Be realistic - this is a modest, 3-star European hotel in a converted building. It has resuling limitations. But if you're realistic in your expecations, it's a fine place. Courteous and helpful staff, well-maintained rooms, conveneint nearby subway stop (Urgell, not Sant Antoni, is much more convenient for most purposes), good individual air conditioning, The neighboord is kind of working class, but not scary as some have reported. The hotel restaurant offers great food at excellent prices - full of locals who obviously think the same thing. Limitations: It faces more an alley than a street, so no view at all and the alley can be an echo chamber for noise. Because it takes a change of elevators to get to most rooms, you will usually end up using lots of stairs, and you will probably get lost the first time. Biggest "problem" is that the hotel oversells itself on it web site. It is smaller, older, and more basic than it wants you to think. (Our room was very clean, but it had not seen basic maintenance for some time.) Still a good solid *** hotel, but false expectations are not good

Reviews.Title: “Hip friendly hotel and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Anitadra
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in early June and loved it. The staff were friendly, rooms comfortable, great shower and it did not feel boxy. Had a fabulous lunch in the restuarant for a very reasonable 9 euros. Location was not too touristy which we liked and an easy walk to public transport. Nice touch with free water and apples. Overall very good vaue for money but not the place for someone after high end luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Can be much better and very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Toekietoekie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from March 25th till 28th.The hotel is located in the centre and the Ramblas is on walking distance. Hotel is nicely furnished and the staff are very friendly and helpful. Hotel seems a bit amateuristic quite a few times. Breakfast is ok but not steady. They forgot to clean our room and we never received a proper apology or compensation. The rooms are extremely noisy and the airconditioning does not work properly.

Reviews.Title: “If only I could have slept!!!”
Reviews.Author: mattypw
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel...I really, really, did. It has so many things going for it; it's small enough to feel like you've stumbled upon a gem, a Vicki-Christina-Barcelona kind of gem. The rooms are hip yet warm, with exposed wooden beams, fantastic geyser-like shower stalls, and cute little details everywhere. Service is spotty, but the staff is so friendly that you can't help but forgive any missteps on their part. The bar on the first floor is something out of Amelie. Add to that complimentary bottled water, a few requisite boutique-hotel-bowls-of-green-apples, and rates around $80, and how can you go wrong? And then you try to sleep. I'm not a particularly heavy sleeper, but if after a bottle and a half of cava I'm still woken up by something as small as a passing motorbike, then there are problems. All night I was constantly rustled awake by trucks, cars, bikes...you name it, and it woke me up. I had a room overlooking the alley on the side of the building with the entrance; my friend was on the opposite side of the hotel (not sure what her view was), but we both would emerge each morning bleary eyed and in dire need of a cup of coffee. The bottom line: the noise is the only reason I would not recommend this hotel to a friend. If you do decide to try it (and I hope some people do!), then bring some earplugs. Alternately, I hope the hotel decides to install some soundproofing!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, neighborhood feel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: maxmim
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay the staff was friendly helpful all that you want from a hotel staff there was a fesdtival at the close by market which made it noisy one night close to flea market, great food market that ran on for blocks, close to the metros and lots of neighborhood hangouts, not at all touristy

Reviews.Title: “Many Good Qualities, But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Market Hotel for 3 nights and generally had a positive experience. The servie is quite good. Our room was large and interesting, with high ceilings and a wonderful shower in the bathroom area (separated from the main room by large sliding doors, one of which did not close entirely). We also experienced excellent service from the staff. The hotel has free Internet, which generally worked well during our stay. The restaurant in the hotel is also very good. The only negative aspect of our experience was noise. We had a room facing the alley that contains the hotel's front entrance. Our room was quite noisy until very late at night and also very noisy early in the morning. We recommend this hotel highly, but if you have problems with noise, you should pay close attention to the placement of your room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, shame about noise and location”
Reviews.Author: SarahJNewcastle
Reviews.Content: The hotel is chic and boutique like, very similar to the rooms in the Banys Orientals, just darker wood and better showers in the Market! So very nicely decorated and a cool vibe. Our main problem was the area, it was about 15 mins to the Ramblas which is fine, we like to walk and see the sites, but it's the area you need to go through to get there that's the problem, a bit a dodgy, run down streets, we walked home the first night and my husband was approached by 2 youths touting a nightclub, they tried to steal his phone from his back pocket but my husband realised what they were doing. So be alert if you're walking about after 10pm in this area! We felt safe in the hotel but not the area. Next time we would stay at the Banys, for a little extra money we would feel safer. Outside was so noisy on a Sunday morning as the people who hold the book market start rolling crates through the alley form about 6.30am, it's like tanks coming down the alley. So we didn't feel rejuvenated put it that way! We didn't have breakfast or dinner but we founf a little local cafe on the street across form San Antoni market, 2 coffees and 2 bocadillos was only 6euros altogether, so it's worth wandering out for breaky if you're on a budget. Head to the area around the Carrer del Carme for some cool restaurants, Rita Rouge is well priced and really funky inside and there are some more small restaurants and bars around that area and the MACBA. We would recommend the hotel but would get a taxi home at night and ask for a quiter room if that's possible!

Reviews.Title: “Could be great but for noise”
Reviews.Author: quark
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Market in Barcelona for 5 nights in the end of October. We did like the hotel but it does have one big drawback. It is very noisy. The floors are hardwood and so you can hear every guest walking as they go to and from their room. Every night we were awakened numerous times by the sound of footsteps and doors slamming and not to mention the noise of the guests themselves. However, this is not the hotel’s fault but that of inconsiderate travelers who think it’s OK to scream with laughter and talk loudly as they walked to their rooms in the middle of the night. There was also a TV that was often left on in another room that could be heard clearly through the walls. So taking an afternoon nap was difficult. We’ve traveled enough to know that there is always some noise in hotels but this was excessive. The hotel itself and the room were stylish and comfortable. The staff was hit or miss as to helpfulness and friendliness. Water and apples are put out free for guests, a nice touch. The restaurant was very pretty but we didn’t eat there although the menu looked interesting and reasonable, nor did we have the breakfast in the hotel. There was a very good bakery/café right across the street. The coffee and sandwiches we had there every morning were terrific. We thought the location of the hotel was great. We were across the street from the Sant Antoni Market and the metro but we walked nearly everywhere. The Ramblas was a 10 to 15 minute walk but really the only thing worth going there for is to see LaBoqueria. Barcelona is an amazing city with so much to see, do and eat. It has a vibrancy that beats NYC and I live here. It is a city that we want to return to someday but we wouldn’t stay at the Hotel Market again.

Reviews.Title: “high design and great location--Noise is a problem”
Reviews.Author: todaystraveler22
Reviews.Content: Very personable staff. Bottles of water and apples a nice touch. Pleasant dining room. Loved that we could walk everywhere including the Born, Ramblas, and Poble Sec and Barcenoleta. Down side was the smell--Natural gas--that seeped in the hotel causing the housekeeper to clean our room with the windows open. Also, the hotel is in the process of adding rooms in what is still an apartment building. For three of the seven nights, construction started at 7 in the morning, waking us up. The first time it happened, the desk offered to switch our room, which I kindly pointed out was not what we wanted as we were asleep. The staff went and asked the worker to stop. The second and third time it happened, the desk said they could do nothing about it as it wasn't their workers causing the problem. Well, it IS the hotel"s problem,because everyone on the floor could hear it. We should have been compensated in some way for this thrice disturbance, but I did not press further. Also, there are no carpets in the hotel, so you hear people walking up and down the halls at all hours as well and hearing guest's nighttime activities till the wee hours was not conducive to sleep. I slept with earplugs most nights. The hotel is very clean, beautifully appointed and the shower/tub was the best of any hotel I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: EuropeLover88
Reviews.Content: A very unique hotel. The room is very cozy and beautiful..Bathroom was awesome.. Stayed there for 3 nights.. Very reasonable price and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: WorldWineGuy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week in Spain and spent it at the Market Hotel. What a fantastic place! Great staff; small, but well appointed rooms with awesome showers. Be careful about getting a room overlooking the street, however, as it can get really noisy...especially between 4:30AM and 6AM when all the trucks are making deliveries to the market. The restaurant in the hotel is excellent also, but be sure to make reservations, as they fill up quickly. I'd skip the breakfast. For 9 euros, you can get better breakfasts anywhere else. There's a great little place directly across the street with pastries, sandwiches and coffee. I will definitely stay at this place again!

Reviews.Title: “Great at the price - but get the right room!”
Reviews.Author: max4048
Reviews.Content: Visited Barcelona - which by the way is fantastic, for my wife's birthday. Get the Bus Turistic tickets which cover the whole city 10E a day. Also airport transfers use the buses outside which take you to the city centre for 5E. The hotel is tucked away and taxi drivers don't know it so make sure you have a map or the address on you. It's actually only about 15 minutes walk from the Placa de Catalunya (Bus Red route start) at the top of the Ramblas and 15 minites from the Placa Espayna (Blue Bus route start). Staff at the hotel vary in helpfulness but pretty good. It was cold in our room which was on the first floor when we arrived and the heating was not working. This was room 106 directly above the bar and reception which has a set of automatic doors. These are noisy as is the road from this room so best advice avoid it! Otherwise inside it is quite nice - slightly strange huge picture of Chairman Mau though which my wife thought rather distubing but didn't nother me. all rooms are decorated in red and black - Spanish style and have walkin showers which are really good and nice and hot. We were moved to romm 108 on the other side of the hotel after they couldn't sort the heating out. Actually a better room though slightly smaller and much quiter. Def take earplugs though. This may just be me living in sleepy Devon but I find noisy cities hard to sleep in. There was a slight sewer smell in the bathroom though and this seems a problem in Barcelona generally as you regularly get a real waft of it passing any drains in the road. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel 10E a head but opted to use a cafe opposite where you can get coffee, local pastry, sandwich etc for 2 for about 6E all in. It did look good though. the hotel has it's own large restaurant which was already fully booked on the Saturday, so if arriving on a Sat and you want an easy life book ahead. . We ate there one night and it was good and relatively inexpensive. All in all a great hotel - we only paid 65E per night so very happy. Free apples and bottled water in the lobby. compared to paris hotels this is the Ritz and would def. use again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “wow wow wow- will definitely get back”
Reviews.Author: romablava
Reviews.Content: Since we stepped into this tastefully designed hotel, we liked it. Check-in went fast and in 10 minutes we were in our room. Front desk staff was very helpfull, room was big enough, bed was very comfortable and bathroom was shining. There are 2 metro stops nearby, but we walked nearly all the time to Las Ramblas. When you visit Hotel Market, have a drink in a bar or outside in a lounge. Free wifi, apples, water and hotel bag was nice touch:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, hidden gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiMaV
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for one significant problem, this would be a 5 start review. The probkem in fact is lack of sound insulation in rooms which, particularly for the lower floors where there is no double glazing, can make for a loud morning. We happened to be woken up by building works above our room (the building houses both the hotel and several private apartments) which went on apparently without the knowledge of management. Management , however, was apologetic and quick to find us another room. Having said all that this is an otherwise wonderful hotel, beautifully designed, relaxed, with a great restaurant and bar. Although the food is excellent and presented in a high class manner it is very inexpensive (most expensive wine on the menu was 14 euros!) . The bar and small terrace outside have been recently opened and are a very pleassant place to hang out and spend some time before or after dinner. Rooms are large, with high ceilings and solid wood floors. Bathrooms are superb with powerful, rain showers, good quality toiletries and thick cotton towels. My wife, an architect, noticed that all the details are right from the workmanship of the tiles to the design of the lights and furniture. Service is very eager even if English is not perfect. Breakfast is excellent with freshly baked pastries as well as frsh chopped tomatoes in olive oil. Wifi is free. Finally, the best thing about this hotel... the price we paid: 65 euros/night for a double room. Nuff said.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hinadori
Reviews.Content: My friend and I only stayed for one night but our experience was great. The room was spacious, modern and beautifully decorated. The location is a little difficult to find since the entrance is through an alley. Hell of a time trying to find that alley. My only complaints are 1) they gave us one bed instead of two and 2) the walls are EXTREMELY thin! Think twice before you consider this a "romantic" stay. We only had a paella from the restaurant and that was with room service so cannot comment on the restaurant itself. But the paella was good if a little too salty. But I found all food in Spain too salty.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel in quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: maggmack
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at the Market Hotel - nice comfortable room - great beds - we were at the back of the hotel which was very quiet. Bit of treck to room - on 4th floor and had to change lifts! Great bathroom but no bath - not a disaster. Safe in room which was appreciated as we were pickpocketed on the metro before we even got to the hotel. Fortunately got that guy and didn't lose anything. Real wake up call though! The location we thought was great - quiet but in walking distance of La Ramblas etc and great for the Parc Montjic side of town. Metro yards away. Didn't bother with breakfast in hotel as plenty of bars etc around. Had a meal at hotel restaurant which was nice and reasonably priced - only thing that spoilt it was surly waiter who messed up our order and wasn't very apologetic. Only downside is TV - only BBC world and no tea or coffee making facilities - BRITS TAKE NOTE! Wished we had taken a travel kettle. Also no fridge in room. Overall a good hotel and we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great food, great location”
Reviews.Author: ednaandneil
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Hotel Market for a long weekend and had a great time. The hotel was located close to the Metro and within walking distance of Las Ramblas, but not too close so the evenings were not noisy. Free water and apples in the reception area was a bonus, especially after a busy day in the heat sightseeing. The food in the restaurant was good and not overly pricey, buffet style breakfast adequate. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get a good room, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: AcquaDiGio
Reviews.Content: On the first night of my stay, I got a room near the main street and it was very noisy. I couldn't get a good rest. Next day, I requested a new room and the staff was very helpful and upgraded me into a double room (for single use) instead. So here's the summary of my experience: PLUS: + Definitely helpful staff and very polite (but i was polite to them too. Whiny rude tourists get nowhere, as rule of thumb). They helped me when I requested a new room, shaver, fork, room service, and lots of other things. + Room on higher floor, facing the inner courtyard are more quiet. So ask for a room on upper floor / facing inner courtyard during the check-in! + Tasteful decoration / nice shower with "rain" shower + Very clean + Safety deposit in the room + Free internet access (although the reception is a bit weak in some room) + Good restaurant + Good location near the city center MINUS: - Rooms near the main street / lower floor are noisy until late night - The walls are quite thin and do not insulate the sound very well. You can actually hear the people in the adjacent rooms talking. - The room was not cleaned everyday until I requested. But maybe because I put the sign "Do not disturb" on my first night. (Although I took off the sign on the following nights, the room was still not cleaned. I wonder why...)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but room choice makes a difference”
Reviews.Author: MollydeA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Barcelona and a stay at the Market Hotel. If we had stayed only one night, I think I would've given the place a bad review, but after staying there a few days (for 3 days in the beginning of our trip, then we traveled to southern Spain, then we stayed again at the hotel for 2 more days at the end of our trip), I grew to love this place, especially for the last 2 days we spent there. Here's the deal: the first room we got smelled like smoke. When we called down to the front desk, they said smoking is allowed in all rooms. If I'd known that, I probably wouldn't have booked a room here (but I'm glad I did). On the other hand, with the window open, the smell went away almost completely, and it didn't invade my clothes at all. And the second room we got (after we'd returned from southern Spain) didn't smell like smoke at all. One other negative: our first room was facing the alley, and it was quite loud - but not constantly so. Every once in awhile, there would be trash pick up (in the middle of the night), or someone drilling something, or someone making some loud noise. But it was only every once in awhile, and we were so tired from sightseeing, that it never kept us awake. (We didn't hear noise from other hotel guests in nearby rooms). The second room we had was totally, completely quiet, even though the two rooms were on the same floor. Now for the good: the room decor is fantastic, the rooms and bathrooms are comfortable. The front desk staff is helpful and friendly. The restaurant is delicious and a bargain (the hotel is bargain, for that matter). The location is nice because it's a little off-the-beaten path, but a quick walk to the Metro and a pretty easy (15 min) walk to La Rambla and surrounding neighborhoods. Another plus: the Aerobus to and from the airport picks up and drops off two blocks away. Wish we'd known that when we arrived in Barcelona. I really recommend this hotel, but room location is important. Ask for a room that faces the back. (Room 308 is great!). I suspect that rooms higher up are also quieter than the ones down low.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, stylish hotel in an unusual building with friendly,helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: DoraCyprus
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to let people know what a nice hotel this was to stay at. We stayed for a week in July with 2 teenagers who loved the design of the rooms & found the rather unusual layout of the building fun & interesting. The staff were all friendly & helpful with advice if we asked for it. Free water & apples were such a thoughtful touch & a real bonus when going sightseeing for the day. Location was good, abount 10-15mins walk to Placa de Catalunya & Las Ramblas with a metro station right round the corner. Also felt safe walking back late at night. Restaurant was excellent for dinner & had a varied breakfast. Price of our stay was very reasonable compared to other hotels. Found reviews so helpful when booking our stay so hope this helps you with yours. Would go back & not hesitate to recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad, depending on the room”
Reviews.Author: nycfashionlover
Reviews.Content: Good: price is excellent. free water and fresh apples is a plus restaurant downstairs is a must go and price is very reasonable. Bad: requested double bed and quiet (higher floor, facing courtyard) for my honeymoon. Was told by the front desk they will do the best for me. went upstairs (after being through two small elevators) found the room is facing streets and two single beds instead of a double. requested a room change, move to 2nd floor with a huge mao's painting hanging in front of the bed. very strange layout and dark room. noise level is very high so i requested a room change the next day. move to higher floor with double bed this time. everything is perfect. depending on which room you are staying it, it will be a very different experience.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DinaB24
Reviews.Content: Ok people, this hotel is fabulous! The rooms are suuuper nice! The bed was comfortable and the A/C was worked great! The location is not too far from Las Ramblas (I walked there in about 10-15mins) and the subway that will take you to all the major places quickly (aka the beach and marina with bars and clubs). Free Wi-Fi in the rooms that worked pretty good and free bottles of water and green apples downstairs all the time... YUMMY. The restaurant was amazing! The food was delicious and the prices were ridiculously reasonable. I recommend this hotel to everyone! Maybe ou won't have the same experience as me, but if you do....IT'S WORTH IT! (PS: write down the EXACT address of the hotel b/c it is on a side street and the business card to the hotel is slightly off and the taxi driver might get lost and drive you around looking for it while the meter is running!)

Reviews.Title: “If These Walls Could Talk...Oh wait, They Do!”
Reviews.Author: Swankalicious
Reviews.Content: Hotel Market is a lovely boutique hotel in El Raval. It's a bit hard to found, nestled in a narrow alley, so make sure you get good directions before you blunder there! The location is overall quite good, close to the Sant Antoni metro and a large outdoor market (hence the name). It's a bit of a hike to the more nightlife-ish areas (Barri Gothic, Born, etc.), but not more than 15 minutes. Nearby, Els Tres Tombs is a good greasy-spoon-type place for late night cravings, and Inopia, one of the area's best tapas bars, is down the street. The rooms are very chic and modern. The bathrooms are stunning: lovely stone-bowl sink and an enormous Vichy-style shower. My husband and I actually took a photo of the shower because we liked it so much! The beds are fairly comfortable and the TV is adequate, with mainly Spanish stations and BBC and SkyNews. WiFi is free. Complaints: There was no clock in our room. On several nights, I discovered small bloodstains (!) on my supposedly freshly laundered pillowcase. Ew! The major drawback is the NOISE. I can't adequately explain how noisy this place is. The walls are thin. On one evening, we were rooming next to some sort of drunken brawl that featured howling, shattering glass, and slamming doors. On another occasion, we were treated to the sounds of hammering and trash-removal at 3:30am. Every night, I was awoken at least once by some sort of bizarre noise. Bring earplugs! Overall, I would recommend Hotel Market with the caveat that it's extremely loud, and there might be better hotels location-wise closer to the nightlife. However, at 130 euros per night, the value is good and, additionally, breakfast is included - a nice touch. We did not dine at the hotel restaurant but heard good things. It was fairly crowded whenever we walked by.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quiksilver26
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel which has been decorated beautifully. My boyfriend and i stayed at the Market Hotel over New Year into 2009 and had a great time. We stayed for 3 nights - good sized room and bathroom. We had a small problem with too much heat in the room from a boiling radiator and the air con not working - but it was soon fixed. We stayed on the third floor - this meant having to get two lifts in different parts of the building, as the hotel is in an old building - not ideal when heaving suitcases around! We ate in the restaurant one night and thought it was very good and very well priced considering the pound is at an all time low! On the whole a lovely hotel, we would stay there again, and its very close to the metro so going anywhere in the city was really easy! We loved Barcelona - only downside coming from Scotland is the airport is in Girona not the main airport in Barcelona and is 90k from the centre. There is no train to take you so we had to pay 150euro each way in a cab - nearly £300 - almost the same price as the accommodation! Downside of the hotel - staff could smile more!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: joanna82
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel. The design was amazing!! The rooms were comfortable and very inviting. Free bottles of water and apples at reception were a nice gesture after a long day sight seeing and shopping. Check in was pretty quick for 6 of us which was nice after arriving late. The free breakfast wasnt anything special but had a few different varieties such as cereal, toast, and different meats along with tea, coffee and fruit juice. The distance to the main street, the Rambla is a nice ten minute walk and a further ten to the marina. We only stayed for a weekend and only saw a few of the main attractions. The cable car was a little disappointing as it didnt go to where we expected and the wait to get on it was near enough an hour from the marina. We realised that its better to climb 200 steps and get on it from the other end. Theres plenty of places to eat in Barcelona, from the well known Hard Rock Cafe to local spanish resturants. I would definately go back as theres alot more to see and do and would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkinavocado
Reviews.Content: The goods: The beds were very comfortable and the free water bottles and apples were fun. The bads: Not a sophisticated hotel. The fire alarm went off twice while we were there (once for a quite a while), the phones have no instructions on them so you don't know how to call to the front desk (much less anywhere else), everything that occurs on your hallway is incredibly LOUD (if you are a light sleeper, this is not the place to stay), upon our arrival they were training a new employee (we understand that people have to be trained but not while weary travelers are waiting to get to their rooms), everything is loose in the bathroom (eg, the fixtures on the sink and the sink itself) and the doorless shower yields quite a lot of water on the floor by the time you are finished, no washcloths, no bar soap. Recommendation: Put off your trip another 4 months and stay at the Banys Oriental. That's what we are doing next time. In all fairness, I will say, again, that the beds were just lovely and the room was very clean and the room was a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Market Hotel, a find!”
Reviews.Author: gorney
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona November 8th and 9th, 2008 and stayed at the Market Hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised with the accomodations. The room was immaculate and the bed very comfortable. The bathroom was huge and the staff were extremely helpful. One draw back was that you had to go through the dining room to get to the rooms and, with the luggage, it was difficult to maneuver. Another was that the hotel was in a neighborhood a bit far from the town center, however, it was a relatively quick cab ride there.

Reviews.Title: “Good but avoid restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Littlehippie
Reviews.Content: Staff - friendly and helpful Accomodation - excellent. huge comfortable bed. really huge bath. lots of hot water. great little private outside terrace. good modern design. Breakfast - the usual, but more than acceptable Location - 2 mins walk from San Antoni metro. So easy access to get around. 15 mins walk from Rambla Restaurant - disappointing to say the least. It promised much but the food was only mediocre. Overall, I'd recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped off by this Hotel... is it possible in hotels!!”
Reviews.Author: NYhotelreviewer
Reviews.Content: I would avoid this hotel... Last week I arrived after a long day on the road to be told my room was not available and that I was being moved to another hotel!! Two managers gave me 2 different reasons for this so clearly I was getting bumped off.. the Hotel where I was moved was far inferior and was told there that The Market does this quite often.ha... so be warned.. Apparently they tried to contact me less than 24hrs before my arrival about this.... had there been a longer notice I could have looked for alternate hotels on my own. The Staff and Manager at The Market were most rude and unhelpful and did NOTHING to compensate me in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent deal, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janooo
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay as it is clean, has a modern Asian feel in the decour, and a decent breakfast to start you on your way. The room was spacious and the bathroom was huge. Book a room away from the elevator or stairway access doors as these can be a tad noisy because all guests go through the same area and the hallways are hardwood flooring. This hotel is close to the subway but make sure you have clear directions to reach it as it took us close to 2 hours to find and the locals didn't seem to know where it was. The surrounding neighbourhood seems a little run-down but perhaps this is just the old feel of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Very New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisMoFFGirl
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Market Hotel recently for two nights. We were impressed with the contemporary, urban design and the comfort of the rooms. We loved that the hotel offered free water bottles and fruit througout our stay. I am a walker and didn't mind the 15 minute walk to the main areas of interest. If you need to go back to the hotel throughout the day, the location might bother you. The only thing that might have been more helpful, was the hotel staff. Although very nice, they did not know how to inform us on how to catch the bus back to the airport. They seemed young and new. I would still recommend this hotel. I felt that for the money, it offered a lot of comfortable ammeneties.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and absolutely fab”
Reviews.Author: blythe243
Reviews.Content: Truly lovely, stylish hotel, very contemporary, tastefully designed, with huge luxurious bathrooms, oversize beds and exceptionally clean. We stayed here twice, and found the room facing the courtyard nicer: it was bigger, sunny and, most important of all, away from quite a busy street. Loved the area of the town it is located as well – far enough to be away from the tourist trail, but close enough to be in the strolling distance to everything. The restaurant is an amazing room, very light and airy. The evening meal we once had there was very nice, if unexceptional. The variety of options offered at breakfast however was realty amazing, and everything very fresh. No problem with the staff whatsoever – we changed our booking and it was not a problem. Restaurant staff were wonderful. Finally, some very small but lovely touches, like free bottled water and apples that kept us going through the day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely spacious rooms & tasty brekkie”
Reviews.Author: sunnysheils
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely long weekend staying at the Market Hotel. Just a short and lovely stroll through Raval to get to tourist-central Ramblas, but far enough away to feel off the beaten track. Didnt experience problems with noise from the market that has been noted in some other reviews. we stayed in a junior suite which was very spacious and quiet with a massive bed. The choc cake at breakfast was gorgeous - washed down with perfect cafe con leche. Reception staff friendly and helpful. Didnt eat at the restaurant though it was full of Spanish diners every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: euros
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautifully appointed, the junior suite in which we stayed was well designed and had one of the best bathrooms I have ever seen in a hotel, and contained a double bath and a walk in rain shower. The suite also had a large terrace, but had the drawback of being overlooked by a number of scruffy looking apartment blocks. Many reviewers have commented on the noise in the hotel. As our suite was in the back of the building I cannot comment on any noise associated with the market however the walls are thin and it was possible to hear people in the next room. The hotel's restaurant is remarkably good value, the food is not by a means haute cuisine but represents good value and when we visited attracted a number of locals. The main downside of the Market hotel however is it's location, although only a couple of minutes from the metro, the line is not a very convenient one for most of the sites except for the Sagrada Familia, and it's a good 15 minute walk from the Rambla and the Barri Gothic through a less than salubrious area, we fond ourself taking taxis back on more than one occasion. On the whole a very nice hotel which I would have no hesitation in recommending to other as long as you don't mind a bit of a walk.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Find”
Reviews.Author: rosey22red
Reviews.Content: The Market Hotel was a fabulous find! When we first arrived I was nervous, I had only seen the pictures online and, compared to what else was on offer, this hotel looked exectionally good value for what you got - I was expecting the worst! However, the Market Hotel turned out to be more than value for money. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, very high-spec and they have though of eveything. Not the largest hotel in the world but definetly perfectly formed. The service was firendly, helpful and accomodating but the real treasure was the restuarant below. We has breakfast in the restuarant every morning, it's included in the price. The choice of food was impressive and great quality and the retuarant itself was beautiful. We also had dinner in the retuarant on our last evening, it was by far the best meal we had in Barcelona. If I had been staying at a high class hotel I would say I had an above average trip, but when we received the bill for our stay we could not believe the exceptional value for such a wonderful stay. The only slight downside is the location, however it is in the centre and the boutique hotel itself, the fantastic value for money and the friendly staff more than make up for it. If you are ever in Barcelona I am sure you will enjoy a night or two at Market Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Underrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welshboyabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Market hotel for roughly a week in october 2007. Its not a top end hotel but well appointed with v v nice restaurant and good breakfast. I found staff very helpful, contraray to other reports even to the point of lending us a laptop to check flights etc. Room very nice but inevitably noisy from the street and some building work next door tough this was never really an issue apart from one night. there was no problem with noise from adjacent rooms, we were at the front with a balcony. Would reccommend and not hesitate to go back, undergound v close and ramblas 20 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ok location”
Reviews.Author: LondonRb
Reviews.Content: The rooms were lovely and the breakfast great. Convenient location for getting around Barcelona on foot. The 2 negatives were: 1. being woken up in the early hours by the lorries delivering to the adjacent market 2. being given incorrect information about finding the bus to the airport, which resulted in stress at the end of the vacation Otherwise, a good value hotel with lovely features.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liz28
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days and really enjoyed our stay we were not disturbed by noise but i bought ear plugs in case we were, the only noise we heard was about 7am in the morning when the street came alive, but then we did have the window slightly ajar, we had a fab large room and a massive bathroom, we had 2 meals in the restaurant and both times we were pleased with the presentation, quality and price, breakfast was included and there was varied variety of food available. Staff were polite and the room was serviced daily.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for 904 and you'll be fine!”
Reviews.Author: lenkre
Reviews.Content: I agree to a certain point with a lot of the bad reviews but all in all, staying at The Market this weekend was a great experience for us! Yes, the hotel is noisy with very thin walls, you can easily hear people talk, sneeze, take a shower etc., but we didn't hear any noise during the nights and you are not supposed to stay in your hotel room when you are in Barcelona anyway... The food in the restaurant is very cheap and of various qualities - stay away from the entrecote and go for fish and you will be fine. The restaurant is crowded with a good vibe and nicely decorated - two seatings in the evening 09:00 and 23:15. The junior suite #904 was stylish and HUGE by European standards with a large terrace and spacious bathroom (including a tub for two and a waterfall shower). The suite is facing the courtyard so it wasn't any noise from the street. And the price was ridiculously low incl taxes and breakfast. And you can eat as many apples or drink as much water as you like from the fridge next to the reception… We thought it was strange that they didn’t have a mini bar in the suite and no room service or a movie channel (they do have a CD-player with the hotel’s lounge music) – but then again, you should spend less time indoors and more time outside in the sun when you are in this gorgeous city. The hotel is not as far from the city centre as I thought, and you can easily walk for 10-15 minutes to reach La Rambla/ the old town. Taxi isn't too expensive either. The front desk was mostly helpful, depending on who was on call, and we were recommended a great massage place called Masajes a 1000 in C/Mallorca 233 who has drop-in massages for couples for whatever time period you want! Perfect after shopping at Passeig de Gracia before you eat lunch at La Polpa www.lapolpa-restaurant.com. I would highly recommend eating at the mansion Can Cortada (www.gruptravi.com) while in Barcelona, especially if you go as a couple, the place is beautiful and the food is simply delicious. Try the steak which they offer as one of their specialities, they prepare it at the table and grill it right in front of you. It was the tenderest meat I have ever tasted. Taxi from the hotel is approximately 15 euros. Well worth it! I will recommend the hotel to all my friends and will definitely go back next time I’m in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.... unsure why the review was so negative”
Reviews.Author: sephine
Reviews.Content: At the time of booking this hotel, there was almost no reviews. It was recommended by Telegraph or something. Then the day before my trip, I read the review and was really worried. I was tempted into cancelling as I cannot withstand noises. However my bf pointed out that we wouldn’t be spending much time there anyway. At arrival, the receptionist seem a little cold at first, but soon warmed up. She recommended loads of lovely walk for us, thank you. We booked the junior suite, room 904. My god, it was amazing for that price. Huge room, huge bathroom and extremely large terrace. The bath tub can actually 2 ppl in it. The shower is huge and strong jet. The terrace was lovely with 2 nice deck chair. I couldn’t hear any noise so may be I was very lucky. The breakfast was ok. There’s Wi-fi in room, but you are borrow laptop to be use downstairs. The restaurant is actually very very cheap, but excellent for that price. Location is good, it’s about 15min walk from Rambla. Or 2 mins from Urgell or Sant Antoni station. BEWARE of Bird poo scam in Barcelona. Someone squirked as with some bird poo stuff, and his team rushed to clean us up. Then another one stole valuables from our bags. Overall, beware of your stuff in Barcelona, but Market hotel is very very good. I think it’s designed to be the next Banys Oriental!

Reviews.Title: “No, no, no, no, no......”
Reviews.Author: Bellamina
Reviews.Content: Our experience of the Market Hotel mirrored much of what has been written below. On arrival the staff appeared disinterested and unwelcoming. There is no porter or assistance with bags, and you are vaguely pointed in the direction of your room. In our case, having booked a Junior Suite, we had to walk through the restaurant with our suitcases. Our room was nicely decorated, the bathroom is great, and we had a small whitewashed terrace with 2 sunloungers. The wardrobes are ridiculously small and inadequate for even a weekend stay. There is no mini bar, no kettle or coffee-making facilities, and no room service that we were aware of. On the plus side there is Sky and BBC News 24, and free broadband access. A few minutes after arrival we became aware of the soundproofing issue, being able to hear absolutely everything going on in the room next door. When we returned to our room in the evening we were also able to hear a lot of noise from the restaurant below. When we complained about this the staff were unable to give us a different room, and astonishingly (given the reviews on this site) claimed that no one else had ever complained about noise from the restaurant! Clearly there is nothing that can be done about this, so if you do stay at the hotel don't forget to bring earplugs. We were awoken at 5am and 7am respectively by the shower being used in the suite next door. Continental breakfast is served in the restaurant; the food is excellent- bread, croissants, ham, cheese, cereal, fruit juice etc, all fresh and of good quality. However, the service was unfriendly and the waitresses needed a lot of prompting to bring your tea or coffee, which was eventually slammed heavily down on the table with a sigh rather than a smile. Not being prepared to put up with such a poor experience, we made quite a lot of fuss on a number of separate occasions with the front desk staff, who were unfriendly/ unwilling/ unable to help. There was never a manager on duty, and not once were we apologised to or any attempt made by the staff to rectify our dissatisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “A triumph of style over substance”
Reviews.Author: oscillator
Reviews.Content: Once you find the place it looks and feels very stylish - we were in a "junior suite" which are in the opposite end of the hotel to the rooms, which means traipsing through the restaurant to get to the lift, but which was large, with a walled terrace. However as a hotel it is hopeless simply because of the much stated complete lack of soundproofing from corridors and especially adjoining rooms. This is definitely NOT a place to spend your honeymoon or a dirty weekend. Great pity really.
